remarks: If the same permutation can be written in more than one way as a product of transpositions, the parity of those products must agree; otherwise the product of one with the inverse of the other would be an odd representation of the identity.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 27-Aug-2015.)
statement:
psgnuni.g $e |- G = ( SymGrp ` D ) $.
psgnuni.t $e |- T = ran ( pmTrsp ` D ) $.
psgnuni.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. V ) $.
psgnuni.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. Word T ) $.
psgnuni.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. Word T ) $.
psgnuni.e $e |- ( ph -> ( G gsum W ) = ( G gsum X ) ) $.
psgnuni $p |- ( ph -> ( -u 1 ^ ( # ` W ) ) = ( -u 1 ^ ( # ` X ) ) ) $.
